benchmark_details.name: RealDex
benchmark_details.overview: RealDex is a pioneering dataset capturing authentic dexterous hand grasping motions infused with human behavioral patterns, enriched by multi-view and multimodal visual data. It is crucial for training dexterous hands to mimic human movements more naturally and precisely.
benchmark_details.data_type: grasping motion sequences with visual data

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Advance research and practical applications of human-like robotic dexterous grasping in real-world environments.

data.source: Collected using a teleoperation system with a Shadow Hand robot and multiple RGB-D cameras.
data.size: 2.6k sequences of grasping motions, 955k frames of visual data
data.annotation: Manually adjusted annotations for hand-object interactions and grasp poses.

methodology.calculation: Comparisons made against pre-defined ground truth data for motion sequences and grasping poses.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in generating human-like grasping motions.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against methods like SAGA and GOAL.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments and real robot testing demonstrate the performance.
